archdesc.runner: Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.abstract: Materials include daily logs, correspondence, photographs, campaign materials, and reports from Shacochis' career with the Navy, Fairfax County Board of Supervisors, and various boards and committees he served on.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the John P. Shacochis papers must be obtained from Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John P. Shacochis papers, C0026, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by John P. Shacochis in 1991.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives staff. EAD markup completed by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty in August 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: John P. Shacochis was born May 30, 1915 in West Pittson, Pennsylvania. Mr. Shacochis began his thirty-three year career with the Federal Government in 1940. During these years he worked for the Social Security Administration, Veterans Administration, Salary Stabilization Board, and for twenty years, as a Management Engineer with the Bureau of Naval Personnel. In 1973, Mr. Shacochis became a Community Planner for Fairfax County, Virginia, and in 1975 was elected Supervisor for the Dranesville District. He served as supervisor until December 31, 1979. During his term he served as a member of the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments, Northern Virginia Transportation Commission, Fairfax County Transportation Safety Commission, Board of Supervisors Fire and Police Committee, Fairfax County/Fairfax City Liaison Committee, COG Air Quality Commission, and Fairfax County Ad Hoc Committee for Prevention of Drug Abuse. He also served on the boards of the Washington Area Transit Authority and Fairfax Hospital Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials include daily logs, correspondence, photographs, campaign materials, and reports from Shacochis' career with the Navy, Fairfax County Board of Supervisors, and various boards and committees he served on.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives also holds many other Northern Virginia personal and organizational political collections.
